title: Billions of Tons of Watermelon are Grown and Harvested this way in the U.S

subtasks: Carefully selecting high-quality watermelon seeds
Preparing the soil, making it loose and fertile
Planting seedlings into pre-prepared furrows with precise spacing
Covering the planted seedlings with a thin layer of soil
Monitoring watermelon plant growth and development
Managing water and fertilizer levels during critical development periods
Observing for the onset of yellow blossoms, the first sign of developing fruit
Assessing watermelons for ripeness by tapping and listening to the sound
Cutting watermelons from the vine with practiced precision
Efficiently tossing and catching watermelons during the harvest process
Inspecting watermelons for quality at processing facilities
Packaging and shipping watermelons to local and international markets
Employing sustainable farming practices and technological advancements
Researching and developing new watermelon varieties to meet market demands
Expanding into new markets and maintaining high production standards
